Description: THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE BORDER ENVIRONMENT INFRASTRUCTURE FUND (BEIF) PROGRAM.  THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES FUNDS FOR DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF COMMUNITY WATER AND WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS WITHIN 100 KILOMETERS NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE US-MEXICO BORDER AND FOR ADMINISTRATIVE AND RELATED COSTS TO THE IMPLEMENTATION AND OVERSIGHT OF THESE PROJECTS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $6,024,473.

THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL REPLACE CONVENTIONAL DIESEL AND GASOLINE POWERED SHUTTLE BUSES WITH ZERO EMISSION SHUTTLES IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA AIRPORTS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,184,875.00.

THIS PROJECT WILL REPLACE 79 PRE-1994 DIESEL POWERED SCHOOL BUSES WITH NEAR ZERO NITROGEN OXIDE (NOX) COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS (CNG) BUSES IN THE LOS ANGELES UNIFIED SCHOOL DISTRICT.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,184,875.00.

THE PURPOSE OF THE TARGETED AIR SHED PROGRAM IS TO REPLACE APPROXIMATELY 237 OLD SELF-PROPELLED OR OFF-ROAD DIESEL TRACTORS THAT OPERATE IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO AGRICULTURAL-BASED COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY (SJV) WITH NEW TRACTORS. THE REPLACEMENT TRACTORS WILL UTILIZE THE CLEANEST AVAILABLE TECHNOLOGY TO MEET THE TIER 4 EMISSION STANDARD IN ORDER TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF POLLUTION IN THE VALLEY.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,184,875.00.

THE PURPOSE OF THE TARGETED AIR SHED PROGRAM IS TO REPLACE APPROXIMATELY 144 ON-ROAD HEAVY DUTY TRUCKS WITH NEWER, CLEANER TRUCKS TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF POLLUTION EMITTED DURING LONG-HAUL AND LOCAL DELIVERY. THE REPLACEMENT OF THE TRUCKS WILL ALSO RESULT IN A REDUCTION OF MOBILE SOURCE EMISSIONS AND ACHIEVE REDUCTIONS IN CARBON MONOXIDE (CO) AND OXIDES OF NITROGEN (NOX) THAT ARE PRECURSOR EMISSIONS OF OZONE AND FINE PARTICULATE MATTER (PM 2.5) IN THE SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY AREA.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,184,875.00.

THE PROJECT REPLACES AN OLD AND DETERIORATED FORCE MAIN THAT CROSSES THE MARE ISLAND STRAIGHT.  FAILURE OF THE FORCE MAIN HAS THE POTENTIAL TO SEVERELY DAMAGE THE SURROUNDING ENVIRONMENT.  THE IMPROVEMENT WILL PROVIDE A LONG TERM RELIABILITY IN CONVEYING WASTEWATER OFF THE ISLAND.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,212,000.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.  PREAWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 9/01/2017.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE PROJECT DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (PDAP).  THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES FUNDS FOR PLANNING AND DESIGN OF COMMUNITY WATER AND WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS WITHIN 100 KILOMETERS NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE US-MEXICO BORDER AND FOR ADMINISTRATIVE AND OTHER COSTS RELATED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OVERSIGHT OF THESE PROJECTS.  ALL PROJECTS BENEFIT THE UNITED STATES.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,000,000.

THE PROJECT WOULD CREATE A WATER SYSTEM LOOP IN THE NORTHERN SECTION OF THE WATER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM BY INSTALLING APPROXIMATELY 4,554 LINEAR FEET (LF) OF 18-INCH WATER MAIN FROM THE EXISTING TERMINUS AT PERKINSVILLE ROAD TO THE 18-INCH WATER MAIN AT ROAD 2 NORTH.  THE PROJECT WILL HELP PROVIDE CLEAN AND RELIABLE DRINKING WATER TO THE RESIDENTS BY INCREASING RELIABILITY.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $485,000.  PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 2/15/2017.

THE CITY OF EL MONTE PROPOSES TO CONSTRUCT TWO NEW STORM DRAIN LINES AND UPGRADE THE EXISTING PUMP STATION TO MINIMIZE FLOODING AT THE GARVEY AVENUE UNDERPASS. THE NEW STORM DRAIN LINES WOULD CONVEY THE OUTFLOW FROM THE NEW PUMP STATION TO A NEW OUTFALL ON THE SAN GABRIEL RIVER, DIVERT SOME STORM WATER AWAY FROM THE UNDERPASS, AND CONNECT TO AN EXISTING LOS ANGELES COUNTY FLOOD CONTROL DISTRICT (LACFCD) STORM DRAIN (DURFEE STORM DRAIN). THE EXISTING PUMP STATION AND PUMPS WOULD BE REPLACED WITH A LARGER CAPACITY PUMP STATION AND PUMPS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $485,000.00.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IDENTIFY AND REPAIR KNOWN FAILURES IN THE CITY OF MAYWOOD SEWER SYSTEM BASED ON THE SEWER MASTER PLAN (SMP) REPORT. THIS PROJECT WILL REQUIRE CONDUCTING THE FILMING (CCTV) OF PIPES NOT COVERED IN THE SMP AND ADDRESS REPLACING THE MISSING, FRACTURED, DAMAGED OR OFFSET PIPES, INCREASING THE SIZE OF THE PIPES WHERE CAPACITY HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED AS A PROBLEM AND LINING THE PIPES WITH POLYVINYL CHLORIDE (PVC) THAT HAVE ONLY MINOR CRACKS BUT STILL MAINTAIN HYDRAULIC INTEGRITY TO PROTECT THEM FROM FURTHER DECAY. THE PROJECT WILL PREVENT FURTHER SANITARY SEWER OVERFLOWS (SSO'S) THAT HAVE BEEN PLAGUING MUCH OF THE CITY IN THE RECENT PAST. IT WILL ALSO DECREASE THE AMOUNT OF INFLOW AND INFILTRATION (I & I) BETWEEN THE SEWER SYSTEM AND THE GROUNDWATER.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $388,000.  PREAWARD ARE APPROVED BACK TO 10/01/2017.

DESCRIPTION:THE OXNARD CONDUIT OF THE OXNARD WATER TRANSMISSION LINE PROJECT CAN SERVE AS MUCH AS 50% OF THE CITY'S WATER SUPPLY AND IS THE ONLY STATE WATER CONNECTION BETWEEN THE CITY AND CALLEGUAS MUNICIPAL WATER DISTRICT. THIS IS CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE, WHICH IS OVER 50 YEARS OLD, IN POOR PHYSICAL CONDITION, AND BEYOND ITS SERVICE LIFE. THE COMMUNITY GRANTS PROGRAM FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT'S NEPA, CEQA, AND PERMITTING REQUIREMENTS. THE OVERALL PROJECT, FUNDED BY OTHER SOURCES, INVOLVES PREPARING A PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING STUDY, DESIGN DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS, AND BID DOCUMENTS FOR THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION PHASE ENGINEERING SERVICES OF A NEW WATER MAIN THAT PARALLELS WITH THE EXISTING OXNARD CONDUIT FROM THE SPRINGVILLE RESERVOIR IN CAMARILLO TO THE CITY'S BLENDING STATION #3 (PHASE 1), AND THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION PHASE ENGINEERING SERVICES FOR THE REHABILITATION OF THE EXISTING OXNARD CONDUIT (PHASE 2). THE EXISTING OXNARD CONDUIT WAS BUILT IN 1968 AND CONSISTS OF 3,755 LINEAR FEET OF 30-INCH STEEL PIPE, 15,793 LF OF 36-INCH STEEL PIPE, AND 19,818 LF OF 45-INCH STEEL PIPE.

THESE PLANNING DOCUMENTS WILL AID THE CITY TO MOVE FORWARD WITH INITIATING CONSTRUCTION ON THE PROPOSED PROJECT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES WITH BE THE RESIDENTS OF OXNARD.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO MONTEREY ONE WATER (M1W) TO RELOCATE CRITICAL ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT AT A COASTAL WASTEWATER PUMP STATION TO DRY, HIGHER GROUND. TO ASSIST IN IMPLEMENTING ITS PROJECT THE AWARD WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR PLANNING, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND DEVELOPMENT OF BASIS OF DESIGN REPORT TO RELOCATE THE ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $400,000. PRE-AWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 05/01/2023.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE:

 TASK 1 - PROJECT COMMENCEMENT
- COLLECT AND REVIEW EXISTING DOCUMENTATION (E.G., DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS, OR SURVEYS) OF THE EXISTING PUMP STATION AND FUTURE SITE OPTIONS.
- SCHEDULE AND CONDUCT A CITY AND M1W PROJECT KICK-OFF MEETING TO CONFIRM:
O PROJECT GOALS, ASSUMPTIONS, CONSTRAINTS/OBSTACLES TO SUCCESSFUL PROJECT OUTCOME,
O COMPLETION WITH M1W MANAGERS AND DESIGNATED CITY STAFF,
O PROJECT TEAM (CITY AND M1W) ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES,
O COMMUNICATION AND MEETING PROTOCOLS, AND
O PROPOSED SCHEDULE, INCLUDING FOR CRITICAL MILESTONES.
TASK 2 - SELECTION OF QUALIFIED EXPERTS
- DEVELOP AND PUBLISH REQUESTS FOR PROPOSALS TO SOLICIT QUALIFIED CONSULTANTS TO CONDUCT THE PLANNING, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND OUTREACH PROCESS AND THE INITIAL PHASE OF THE DESIGN PROCESS.
- FOLLOW THE M1W PROCUREMENT MANUAL TO SELECT EACH CONSULTANT IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL PROCUREMENT REQUIREMENTS (INCLUDE CITY STAFF ON COMMITTEE, IF FEASIBLE), RECEIVE COMMITTEE AND BOARD APPROVAL, AND FINALIZE CONTRACTS.
TASK 3 - PROJECT MANAGEMENT
- CONDUCT KICK-OFF MEETINGS AND BI-MONTHLY PROGRESS MEETINGS WITH INTERNAL PROJECT TEAM, AND OTHERS AS NEEDED, TO MANAGE THE PROJECT AND EFFECTIVELY COMPLETE THE ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTS AND THE FIRST PHASE OF THE DESIGN DOCUMENTS.
- COORDINATE INFORMATION EXCHANGE AND COMMUNICATION BETWEEN TEAM MEMBERS.
TASK 4 - SITE INVESTIGATION
- VISIT PROJECT SITE AND OBSERVE EXISTING CONDITIONS AND OBSERVE LOCATION AND CONDITION OF NEW SITE, INCLUDING EXISTING UTILITIES AND LOCATIONS OF INTERFERENCES.
TASK 5 - BASIS OF DESIGN
- COLLABORATE WITH THE CITY OF PACIFIC GROVE TO IDENTIFY A PROCESS TO DEFINE THE PROJECT FOR THE PURPOSE THE DESIGN, INCLUDING THE APPROPRIATE PUBLIC OUTREACH DURING DESIGN.
- PREPARE BASIS OF DESIGN REPORT (BODR) WHICH DESCRIBES KEY ASSUMPTIONS, FEATURES OF THE PROJECT, AND DESCRIBES TWO TO THREE ALTERNATIVE LOCATIONS AND/OR DESIGNS, INCLUDING DATA, DESCRIPTIONS, MAPS, AND FIGURES AT THE LEVEL OF DETAIL NEEDED TO CONDUCT THE ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW AND TO PREPARE A COASTAL DEVELOPMENT PERMIT APPLICATION.
- CONDUCT AN INTERNAL MEETING WITH CITY AND M1W KEY STAFF TO REVIEW THE DRAFT BODR AND SELECT PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE; USE SELECTED PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE TO CREATE CONCEPTUAL
SITE PLAN AND ARCHITECTURAL RENDERING.
- IDENTIFY REQUIRED CONSTRUCTION PHASE PERMIT AND PREPARE A SUMMARY OF PERMIT REQUIREMENTS IN THE BODR UPDATE.
TASK 6 - TECHNICAL STUDIES
- PERFORM TECHNICAL SURVEYS AND ANALYSIS IN THE ISSUE AREAS OF AESTHETICS,* AIR QUALITY AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS, * BIOLOGICAL RESOURCES,* CULTURAL RESOURCES* (INCLUDING NATIVE AMERICAN AND TRIBAL CONSIDERATIONS IN COMPLIANCE WITH CALIFORNIA AB 52 AND THE NHPA AND TRIBAL PROTECTION), HYDROLOGY AND WATER QUALITY,* NOISE AND VIBRATION, PUBLIC SERVICES AND UTILITIES, TRAFFIC AND TRANSPORTATION, AND ANY OTHER CATEGORY OF ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW AS REQUIRED BY STATE AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS FOR THE PROJECT.
- DOCUMENT RESULTS IN MEMORANDA FOR KEY TOPICS INDICATED BY *.
TASK 7 - PREPARE AND DISTRIBUTE INITIAL STUDY
- PREPARE AND DISTRIBUTE THE INITIAL STUDY TO THE PROJECT TEAM.
- CONDUCT REQUIRED NATIVE AMERICAN AND TRIBAL OUTREACH.
- FACILITATE AT LEAST ONE ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW INITIATION MEETING WITH INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS (PC, OS, EPA COASTAL

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS AUTHORIZED BY THE CONGRESSIONALLY DIRECTED SPENDING (CDS)/COMMUNITY PROJECT FUNDING (CPF) (COMMUNITY GRANTS) WATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT PURSUANT TO THE FY2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT (P.L. 117-103), TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE PLANNING AND DESIGN OF WATER IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF JOHNSTON, IOWA TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT SEWER EXTENSION PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO PROVIDE SERVICE TO AN AREA APPROXIMATELY 3,130 ACRES WEST OF HWY 141. DUE TO TOPOGRAPHY, A NEW LIFT STATION WILL BE INSTALLED THAT ALLOWS FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENTS TO CONNECT VIA GRAVITY MAINS. THE LIFT STATION WILL CONSIST OF INSTALLING THREE SUBMERSIBLE PUMPS, ELECTRICAL COMPONENTS, A BACKUP GENERATOR, AND PIPING THAT ALLOWS FOR FUTURE STORAGE TANKS TO STORE SANITARY WASTE AND ELIMINATE ILLICIT DISCHARGES SHOULD THERE BE SYSTEM FAILURES. FROM THE LIFT STATION, DUAL FORCE MAINS WILL BE INSTALLED TO PROVIDE REDUNDANCY AND CAPACITY FOR WET AND DRY WEATHER FLOWS. THE FORCE MAINS WILL DISCHARGE TO GRAVITY MAIN ALONG NW TOWNER DRIVE JUST EAST OF HWY 141 AT A MANHOLE WITH A WEIR STRUCTURE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE TO INSTALL A NEW LIFT STATION AND CORRESPONDING SEWER MAINS TO PROVIDE PROPER SERVICE TO ANNEXED AREAS FOR ENSURING APPROPRIATE TREATMENT OF SANITARY WASTEWATER, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO AN ENERGY EFFICIENT SANITARY SEWER COLLECTION SYSTEM THAT PROVIDE SAFE AND RELIABLE CONVEYANCE OF SANITARY WASTEWATER FOR 3,130 ACRES AND WILL REDUCE THE LIKELIHOOD OF SANITARY OVERFLOWS DUE TO THE INCREASED CAPACITY FOR HANDLING HIGH FLOW EVENTS FOR THE 24,064 RESIDENTS OF JOHNSTON, IOWA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF CRESTON, IOWA TO IMPLEMENT ITS WATER INTAKE PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE PART 1 OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL UPGRADE THE 12 MILE INTAKE BY REPLACING ALL ELECTRICAL COMPONENTS, INSTALLING NEW VFDS AND MOTORS, REPAIR ANY DAMAGE TO THE BUILDING AND ADDRESS ANY DNR CONCERNS FROM OUR MOST RECENT SANITARY SURVEY. THIS INCLUDES TUCKPOINTING THE MASONRY AT THE INTAKE BUILDING, REPAIRING THE HVAC IN THE CLARIFIER ROOM, AND ADDRESSING THE REQUIREMENT FOR A NO DISCHARGE SEPTIC SYSTEM AT THE INTAKE. PART 2 OF THE PROJECT WILL BE TO INSTALL VFDS ON THE MEMBRANE SYSTEM BLOWERS, FLOW PACE THE COAGULANT SYSTEM, UPGRADE THE ALARM SYSTEM, REPAIR VALVES TO ALLOW FOR GREATER FLEXIBILITY IN USE OF THE EXISTING GROUND STORAGE RESERVOIRS, AND OTHER MINOR CHANGES TO ALLOW FOR GREATER OPERATING FLEXIBILITY. BOTH PARTS OF THE PROJECT WILL BE COORDINATED SIMULTANEOUSLY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE INSTALLATION OF VFDS, CHANGE OUT VALVES, FLOW-PACE CHEMICAL FEED SYSTEMS, INSTALL ENERGY EFFICIENT MOTORS, AND REPAIR AGING BUILDINGS, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO REDUCE ENERGY COSTS, OPTIMIZE CHEMICAL FEED OPERATIONS, AND PROVIDE SAFE AND RELIABLE DRINKING WATER FOR THE 7800 RESIDENTS OF CRESTON, IOWA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF SLATER, MISSOURI TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT FOR WELL PROTECTION AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO UPGRADE AND RENOVATE THE EXISTING NARROW ACCESS ROAD TO THE CITY'S WATER SUPPLY WELLS. THE PORTION OF THE EXISTING ROAD TO REACH WATER SUPPLY #8 WILL BE RAISED WITH COMPACTED FILL AND RESURFACED WITH AGGREGATE TO MATCH THE ELEVATION OF THE EXISTING ACCESS ROAD FOR WATER SUPPLY #6. THE ENTIRE ACCESS ROAD FOR WATER SUPPLY WELLS NUMBER 6 AND 8 WILL BE WIDENED BY THREE FEET AND WILL REQUIRE ADDITIONAL EARTHEN FILL. THE EXISTING ACCESS ROAD TO WATER SUPPLY WELL #7 WILL ALSO BE SURFACED WITH AGGREGATE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE TO PROVIDE FOR ACCESS ROAD IMPROVEMENTS AND A PROPANE GENERATOR TO PROVIDE FOR CONTINUED OPERATION DURING ELECTRICAL OUTAGES, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO MAINTAIN ADEQUATE ACCESS AND RELIABLE OPERATION OF THE WATER SUPPLY WELLS WHILE PROVIDING SAFE AND RELIABLE DRINKING WATER FOR THE 1834 RESIDENTS OF SLATER, MISSOURI.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF GLEN COVE TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO REHABILITATE THE NANCY COURT PUMP STATION, IMPROVING THE WELL SCREEN, CASING, ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT, AND CONTROL SYSTEMS AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: RAISING THE EXISTING WELL ABOVE GRADE, DEMOLISHING THE EXISTING WELL VAULT, LINING THE EXISTING WELL, INSTALLING A PREFABRICATED CONCRETE BUILDING OVER THE WELL, AND PERFORMING MISCELLANEOUS ELECTRICAL IMPROVEMENT AS NEEDED. THE PUMP STATION SERVES APPROXIMATELY 28,000 RESIDENTS, AND THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL DIRECTLY INCREASE THE SUPPLY AND QUALITY OF CLEAN DRINKING WATER PROVIDED TO THE POPULATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO MONTGOMERY COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT TO IMPLEMENT A PROJECT TO SUPPORT TEN COMMUNITY-BASED, SMALL SCALE RESTORATION PROJECTS TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN LOCAL STREAMS AND WATERWAYS AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO INSTALL FIVE CONSERVATION LANDSCAPING PRACTICES, FOUR BIORETENTION/RAINGARDENS, ONE PERVIOUS PAVEMENT DRIVEWAY, PLANT THREE HUNDRED TREES, AND DEVELOP THREE COMPREHENSIVE STORMWATER DESIGN PLANS FOR TEN SEPARATE COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO INSTALL FIVE CONSERVATION LANDSCAPING PRACTICES, FOUR BIORETENTION/RAINGARDENS, ONE PERVIOUS PAVEMENT DRIVEWAY, PLANT THREE HUNDRED TREES, AND DEVELOP THREE COMPREHENSIVE STORMWATER DESIGN PLANS FOR TEN SEPARATE COMMUNITIES.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE TO INSTALL GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE, PLANT TREES, AND DEVELOP STORMWATER MANAGEMENT PLANS WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO IMPROVED WATER QUALITY IN LOCAL STREAMS AND WATERWAYS. BENEFICIARIES OF THE ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL BE THE RESIDENTS OF MONTGOMERY COUNTY, MD.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO DIGDEEP TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO DESIGN AND INSTALL 35 ONSITE WASTEWATER TREATMENT SYSTEMS IN TWO REGIONS OF MCDOWELL COUNTY, WV AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:DIGDEEP WILL IDENTIFY 35 HOUSEHOLDS IN MCDOWELL COUNTY THAT LACK OR HAVE FAILING HOME WASTEWATER TREATMENT SYSTEMS. ONCE IDENTIFIED, DIGDEEP WILL CONTRACT WITH ONE OR MORE QUALIFIED ONSITE SEPTIC INSTALLERS THAT WILL CONDUCT SOIL PERCOLATION TESTS, DESIGN, PERMIT AND INSTALL 35 COMPLIANT ONSITE WASTEWATER TREATMENT SYSTEMS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT AN ESTIMATED 80 MCDOWELL COUNTY RESIDENTS THROUGH 35 ONSITE WASTEWATER TREATMENT SYSTEMS. THESE SYSTEMS WILL GREATLY REDUCE STRAIGHT-PIPING OF RAW SEWAGE INTO MCDOWELL COUNTY'S RIVERS, STREAMS, AND OTHER WATERWAYS. BY REDUCING STRAIGHT-PIPING OF RAW SEWAGE INTO MCDOWELL COUNTY'S RIVERS, STREAMS, AND OTHER WATERWAYS ANOTHER 17,000 RESIDENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM GREATLY IMPROVED WATER QUALITY. IMPROVED WATER QUALITY CAN IMPROVE HEALTH BY REDUCING INSTANCES OF WATERBORNE ILLNESS OR ISSUES RELATED TO CONTAMINATION, DECREASE THE CONSUMPTION OF UNHEALTHFUL BEVERAGES, AND ENSURE THERE IS CLEAN WATER TO MAINTAIN HYDRATION AND HYGIENE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH, VIRGINIA, TO CONDUCT A LEAD SERVICE LINE INVENTORY PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE HIRING A CONTRACTOR TO CONDUCT THE INVENTORY FOR THE CITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE AN INVENTORY OF LEAD SERVICE LINES WITHIN THE CITY FOR POTENTIAL FUTURE REPLACEMENT PROJECTS. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITY AND THE RESIDENTS OF PORTSMOUTH.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO TOWN OF OCEANA TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO REPAIR AND REMEDY THE INFLOW AND INFILTRATION (IANDI) WITHIN THE EXISTING COLLECTION SYSTEM AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL REMEDY: STORM SEWER CROSS CONNECTIONS, SEWER MAIN LEAKS, BROKEN LATERALS, AND BROKEN OR LEAKING MANHOLES.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS A SIGNIFICANT REDUCTION IN IANDI, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO LEAD TO NPDES PERMIT COMPLIANCE, IMPROVED OPERATION OF THE COLLECTION SYSTEM AND SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANT, AND PROTECT AND ENHANCE THE WATER QUALITY OF THE CLEAR FORK CREEK.  BENEFICIARIES OF THE ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT WILL BE THE RESIDENTS OF OCEANA, WV.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF NORFOLK, VIRGINIA, TO IMPLEMENT THE RIVER OAKS PUMP STATION REPLACEMENT PROJECT, THE WEST OCEAN VIEW PUMP STATION PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT. THIS AGREEMENT ALSO PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE BALLENTINE PLACE WATER AND SEWER REPLACEMENT PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2023 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE: (1) AT THE RIVER OAKS PROJECT, THE CITY WILL REPLACE APPROXIMATELY 2,600 LINEAR FEET OF GRAVITY SEWER AND WATER DISTRIBUTION MAINS; (2) AT THE WEST OCEAN VIEW PROJECT, THE CITY WILL REPLACE APPROXIMATELY 2,800 LINEAR FEET OF GRAVITY SEWER AND 3,500 LINEAR FEET OF WATER DISTRIBUTION MAINS; AND, (3) AT THE BALLENTINE PLACE PROJECT, THE CITY WILL REPLACE APPROXIMATELY 2,600 LINEAR FEET OF GRAVITY SEWER AND WATER DISTRIBUTION MAINS. ALL THREE PROJECTS WILL ALSO INCLUDE INSTALLATION OF ASSOCIATED MANHOLES, CLEANOUTS, FITTINGS, VALVES, HYDRANTS, AND PAVEMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FOR ALL THREE PROJECTS ARE INSTALLATION OF SEWER AND WATER DISTRIBUTION MAINS, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO HIGHER QUALITY DRINKING WATER, RELIABLE FIRE PROTECTION, AND PROPER SEWAGE DISPOSAL FOR THE RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF NORFOLK, VIRGINIA.

FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,600,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO CANAAN VALLEY PUBLIC SERVICE DISTRICT, WV TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO CONSTRUCT A NEW WATER TREATMENT PLANT (WTP) TO PROVIDE POTABLE WATER SERVICE AND SUPPORT FUTURE WATER DEMANDS AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW WATER TREATMENT PLANT WHICH WILL PROVIDE POTABLE WATER SERVICE TO THE CANAAN VALLEY PUBLIC SERVICE DISTRICT. CURRENT WATER SOURCES AND TREATMENT METHODS DO NOT ADEQUATELY MEET THE NEEDS OF THE AREA AND A RECENT SOURCE WATER ANALYSIS DETERMINED THAT THE CURRENT SOURCE NEEDS ADDITIONAL TREATMENT BEFORE BEING DISTRIBUTED TO CUSTOMERS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO HODGESVILLE PUBLIC SERVICE DISTRICT, WV TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO REHABILITATE THE WATER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REPLACING APPROXIMATELY 1,200 WATER METERS, INSTALLATION OF TWO NEW 100,000-GALLON WATER STORAGE TANKS COMPLETE WITH FOUNDATIONS AND VALVING, INSTALLATION OF ONE NEW 150 GPM BOOSTER PUMP STATION (BPS) WITH ASSOCIATED TELEMETRY EQUIPMENT, REPLACEMENT/INSTALLATION OF APPROXIMATELY 14,100 LINEAR FEET OF SERVICE TUBING AND APPROXIMATELY 21,500 LINEAR FEET OF VARIOUS SIZE MAIN WATER LINE, INCLUDING AN EXTENSION TO SERVE FIVE NEW CUSTOMERS, UPGRADING THE HALL ROAD BOOSTER PUMP STATION BPS, REPLACING THE PRV IN THE GUM MOUNTAIN AREA, UPGRADING THE SITE AT THE EXISTING SHUMAKER WATER STORAGE TANK, AND OTHER NECESSARY VALVES AND APPURTENANCES REQUIRED TO BE UPGRADED IN THE DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE REHABILITATING THE HODGESVILLE PSD SYSTEM, WATER METERS, WATER STORAGE TANKS, AND A BOOSTER PUMP STATION, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO A REDUCTION IN ITS WATER LOSS EXPENSES, INCREASED RELIABILITY, AND SECURITY IN THE SYSTEM. OVERALL GENERAL SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS WILL ALLOW OPERATORS TO EFFECTIVELY IDENTIFY AND REPAIR ISSUES AND BENEFIT CITIZENS OF HODGESVILLE, WV BY LOWERING OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE COSTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF MANASSAS, VIRGINIA, TO IMPLEMENT ITS TRANSMISSION MAIN REPLACEMENT PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REPLACING 4,000 LINEAR FEET OF 24-INCH STEEL PIPE WITH 36-INCH DUCTILE IRON PIPE ALONG FITZGERALD WAY AND INSTALLATION OF ASSOCIATED FITTINGS, VALVES, HYDRANTS, AND CONNECTIONS TO THE EXISTING TRANSMISSION MAIN. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE REPLACEMENT OF 4,000 FEET OF 24-INCH STEEL PIPE WITH 36-INCH DUCTILE IRON PIPE, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO A MORE RELIABLE AND RESILIENT DRINKING WATER SYSTEM FOR THE RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF MANASSAS, VIRGINIA.

DESCRIPTION:THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT TO CONDUCT RESEARCH THAT SUPPORTS COMMUNITY AND HOUSEHOLD RESILIENCE TO WILDFIRE SMOKE THROUGH ACTIONS THAT MITIGATE ADVERSE HEALTH OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH WILDFIRE SMOKE EXPOSURES.ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT WILL APPLY PRACTICE-DRIVEN APPLIED RESEARCH WITH OREGON COMMUNITIES AND PARTNERS. THE RESEARCH TEAM WILL FACILITATE INFORMATION SHARING AND NETWORKS BETWEEN PRACTITIONERS, MANAGERS, AND RESEARCHERS TO ALLOW RESEARCHERS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE INFORMATION GAPS AND NEEDS OF PRACTITIONERS ON THE GROUND AND TO ACCELERATE THE EFFECTIVE DISSEMINATION OF RESEARCH FINDINGS INTO PRACTICE. THE TEAM WILL DISSEMINATE RESEARCH CONDUCTED BY THE CENTER AND PARTNERS TO SPECIFIC AUDIENCES OF INTEREST, THROUGH WEB-BASED APPLICATIONS, TECHNICAL REPORTS, SHORT FACT SHEETS, INFOGRAPHICS, PRESENTATIONS, AND OTHER FORMS OF ACCESSIBLE INFORMATION SHARING.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ANNUAL AND FINAL RESEARCH REPORTS AS WELL AS JOURNAL ARTICLES AND BRIEFING PAPERS DOCUMENTING THE ACTIVITIES AND FINDINGS FROM THE PROJECT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED ABILITY OF OREGONIANS' TO PREPARE FOR, RESPOND TO, AND RECOVER FROM WILDFIRE SMOKE EVENTS IN ORDER TO REDUCE ADVERSE HEALTH OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH WILDFIRE SMOKE EXPOSURES AS WELL AS NEW KNOWLEDGE AND EFFICACIOUS STRATEGIES THAT OFFER IMPORTANT EVIDENCE-BASED APPROACHES THAT CAN BE APPLIED ACROSS THE WESTERN U.S. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE OREGON RESIDENTS, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO HELP ADDRESS HARMFUL ENVIRONMENTAL TRENDS IN THE KODIAK REGION OF ALASKA THROUGH CONTINUOUS PHYTOPLANKTON MONITORING AND BI-WEEKLY SHELLFISH SAMPLING. THE KODIAK AREA NATIVE ASSOCIATION (KANA) HAS IDENTIFIED THE PRESENCE OF THREE DIFFERENT GENUSES OF PHYTOPLANKTON THAT POSE A THREAT TO HUMAN HEALTH AND MARINE MAMMALS, AND ONE OF THEM CAN PRODUCE SAXITOXIN, THE TOXIN RESPONSIBLE FOR PARALYTIC SHELLFISH POISONING (PSP). BECAUSE SOME OF THE HIGHEST TOXIN VALUES IN THE STATE OF ALASKA HAVE BEEN RECORDED IN KODIAK WATERS, TRIBAL MEMBERS AND OTHER KODIAK SUBSISTENCE RESOURCE USERS HAVE STRESSED THE IMPORTANCE OF MONITORING AND RESEARCH THAT WILL HELP REDUCE THEIR RISK OF HARVESTING DURING A PSP EVENT. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP CONTINUE TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL TRENDS THAT POSE A THREAT TO HUMAN HEALTH AND OTHER MAMMALS UTILIZED AS SUBSISTENCE RESOURCES BY NATIVE AND NON-NATIVE ALASKANS. ACTIVITIES:THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW KANA TO MONITOR HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOMS (HABS) IN KODIAK WATERS, COLLECT WEEKLY PHYTOPLANKTON SAMPLES AND REGULAR BI-WEEKLY MONITORING AND TESTING OF SHELLFISH FOR TOXINS THAT COULD CAUSE PARALYTIC SHELLFISH POISONING (PSP). THE RESEARCHERS WILL ALSO COLLABORATE WITH TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF IN VILLAGES AND ON THE KODIAK ROAD SYSTEM ABOUT HABS AND SHELLFISH TESTING. DATA FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED TO CREATE ADVISORIES FOR SHELLFISH HARVESTING AT SEVERAL SAMPLE LOCATIONS ON THE KODIAK ROAD SYSTEM AND IN PARTICIPATING VILLAGES. THE PROJECT IS ALSO DESIGNED TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT HABS AND BIOTOXINS IN KODIAK WATERS AMONG TRIBES AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DATA FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED TO CREATE REGULAR ADVISORIES FOR SHELLFISH HARVESTING AT SEVERAL SAMPLE LOCATIONS ON THE KODIAK ROAD SYSTEM AND IN PARTICIPATING VILLAGES. THE RECIPIENTS ALSO PLAN TO CREATE OUTREACH AND PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS, FLYERS, SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS AND OTHER MEANS OF DISSEMINATING THE INFORMATION AND THESE WILL INCLUDE THAT KANA WILL ACCEPT SHELLFISH FROM SUBSISTENCE HARVESTERS AND PROVIDING SHELLFISH TOXIN RESULTS SO THEY CAN MAKE INFORMED HARVEST DECISIONS. THE RECIPIENT WILL SUBMIT ANNUAL REPORTS ON THEIR PROJECT AND FOR THE FINAL REPORT, THEY PLAN TO COLLABORATE WITH KODIAK TRIBES AND THE SITKA TRIBE OF ALASKA ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH LAB (STAERL) TO COMPILE SAMPLES AND ENVIRONMENTAL DATASETS FOR PARALYTIC SHELLFISH POISONING INTO A FINAL REPORT.

DESCRIPTION:THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A STATE-WIDE STRATEGY TO ADDRESS PFAS-CONTAMINATED SOILS AND GROUNDWATER AT MULTIPLE SITES AROUND THE STATE OF ALASKA. TO SUPPORT THIS OBJECTIVE, THE RESEARCHERS PLAN TO INVESTIGATE THE AVAILABLE TECHNOLOGIES FOR TREATING PFAS-CONTAMINATED SOILS AND THEIR APPLICABILITY TO ALASKA'S EXTREME ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS, AS WELL AS THE NEEDS OF REMOTE COMMUNITIES TRYING TO ADDRESS PFAS-CONTAMINATED SITES. THIS INVESTIGATION IS EXPECTED TO INCLUDE LABORATORY STUDIES ON HOW FREEZE/THAW CYCLES AFFECT THE EFFICACY OF CURRENTLY AVAILABLE TREATMENT TECHNOLOGIES. ALASKA CURRENTLY LACKS THE ANALYTICAL CAPABILITY TO MEASURE PFAS IN ENVIRONMENTAL MEDIA. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO CREATE A PFAS-FOCUSED LABORATORY AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ALASKA, FAIRBANKS. ACTIVITIES:THE RESEARCHERS WILL: (1) EVALUATE EFFECTIVE PFAS CONTAMINATED SOIL AND GROUNDWATER TREATMENT OPTIONS FOR USE IN ALASKA; (2) WORK WITH STATE AGENCIES TO DEVELOP A STRATEGY FOR TREATING PFAS-CONTAMINATED SOIL, SURFACE WATER, AND GROUNDWATER IN URBAN AND REMOTE AREAS IN ALASKA; AND (3) ESTABLISH A LABORATORY AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ALASKA FAIRBANKS (UAF) IN THE WATER AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH CENTER (WERC) FOR ANALYSIS OF SOIL AND WATER FOR PFAS COMPOUNDS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ANNUAL AND FINAL RESEARCH REPORTS AS WELL AS FROM THIS PROJECT INCLUDE A STRATEGY FOR REMEDIATING PFAS CONTAMINATED SOIL AND GROUNDWATER IN ALASKA AND A NEW LABORATORY HOUSED AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ALASKA FAIRBANKS DEDICATED TO ANALYSIS OF PFAS COMPOUNDS AND OTHER EMERGING ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINANTS.. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT IN THE STATE OF ALASKA. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE ALASKA RESIDENTS, STATE AND LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGERS, AND COMMUNITIES FACING SIMILAR CHALLENGES MEASURING PFAS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IDENTIFY THE EXTENT AND SOURCES OF PFAS CONTAMINATION IN WASTEWATER IN DELAWARE. THE RESULTS OF THE RESEARCH WILL HELP IDENTIFY THE MEANS TO PREVENT CONTAMINATION OF DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES.ACTIVITIES:THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO 1) SCREEN WASTEWATER AND SLUDGE FROM SELECTED WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANTS (WWTPS) FOR FLUORINE-CONTAINING ORGANIC CHEMICALS USING TOTAL ORGANO-FLUORINE AND TOTAL PFAS METHODS; 2) QUANTIFY THE AMOUNT OF PFAS IN THE WATER AND SOLID RESIDUE USING THE TARGETED METHOD LC/MS/MS FROM THE SAME WASTEWATER PLANTS; AND 3) COMPARE THE AMOUNTS OF PRECURSORS AND INTERMEDIATES IN THE WASTEWATER AND SLUDGE IN WWTPS AS A FUNCTION OF SEASONAL VARIATIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ANNUAL AND FINAL REPORTS, AS WELL AS GUIDANCE TO WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT (WWTP) OPERATORS AND MANAGERS ABOUT ANALYTICAL METHODS, LEVELS OF PFAS AND OTHER ORGANO-FLUORINE COMPOUNDS AS WELL AS POTENTIAL MITIGATION STRATEGIES SPECIFIC TO THEIR PROCESSES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE STATE AND LOCAL LEGISLATORS LOOKING TO UNDERSTAND THE EXTENT OF PFAS DISCHARGES INTO THE ENVIRONMENT, DELAWARE RESIDENTS, HUMAN HEALTH, THE ENVIRONMENT, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
THIS PROJECT WILL DEMONSTRATE DECENTRALIZED WASTEWATER TREATMENT IN THE LOWER FLORIDA KEYS.  THE INFORMATION WILL SERVE AS A MANAGEMENT INFORMATION R

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO PORT OF BROOKINGS HARBOR TO IMPLEMENT PHASE 1 (INITIAL PLANNING AND DESIGN) OF THEIR INDUSTRIAL WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT PROJECT, AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE PRE-SITEWORK INCLUDING PROJECT DEVELOPMENT, PLANNING, PRELIMINARY DESIGN, PROJECT MANAGEMENT INCLUDING NEGOTIATIONS WITH STAKEHOLDERS, AND OBTAINING A UNITED STATES ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS WORK-IN-WATER PERMIT AND A NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM PERMIT FROM OREGON DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THE INITIAL PROJECT DESIGN AND OBTAINING A NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM PERMIT FROM OREGON DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND A WORK-IN-WATER PERMIT FROM THE UNITED STATES ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO THE CONSTRUCTION OF A LARGER WASTEWATER PLANT PROJECT THAT WILL IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN THE CHETCO ESTUARY FOR THE RESIDENTS OF BROOKINGS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO LAKEWOOD WATER DISTRICT TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT FOR PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES (PFAS) REMEDIATION AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE THE CONSTRUCTION OF TWO NEW WELLS, ANCILLARY BUILDINGS, AND PIPING TO CONNECT WELLS TO EXISTING DRINKING WATER INFRASTRUCTURE, AS WELL AS PLANNING AND DESIGN WORK IN SUPPORT OF THE PROJECT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE ENVIRONMENTAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE ASSESSMENTS, ENGINEERING DESIGN OF FACILITIES AT THE NEW WELLS, AND CONSTRUCTION OF THE WELLS AND ANCILLARY STRUCTURES/PIPING, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO AN UNCONTAMINATED DRINKING WATER SUPPLY FOR THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS THAT RECEIVE THEIR DRINKING WATER FROM LAKEWOOD WATER DISTRICT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF KETCHIKAN FOR THE TONGASS SEWER FORCE MAIN REHABILITATION PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE REHABILITATION OF A 1,250 LINEAR FOOT SEWER PIPE IN SITU BY INSERTING A HIGH DENSITY POLYETHYLENE SLEEVE, ALSO KNOWN AS TRENCHLESS SLIPLINING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS THE REHABILITATED SEWER PIPE WHICH WILL EXTEND ITS USEFUL LIFE, WHICH WILL IN TURN IMPROVE WATER QUALITY BY REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF UNTREATED SEWAGE ENTERING THE ENVIRONMENT AND DECREASE THE AMOUNT OF INFILTRATION AND INFLOW (I/I) THAT IS CURRENTLY BEING TREATED AT THE WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF KETCHIKAN, ALASKA AND THE GREATER ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO CLARK REGIONAL WASTEWATER DISTRICT TO IMPLEMENT ITS CURTAIN CREEK SEPTIC ELIMINATION PROGRAM PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF APPROXIMATELY 4,952 LINEAR FEET OF AN 8-INCH SANITARY SEWER SYSTEM AND APPROXIMATELY 2,313 LINEAR FEET OF 4-INCH LATERAL PIPE TO SEVENTY-EIGHT PARCELS IN THE SUNSET STRIP NEIGHBORHOODS WITHIN THE CURTAIN CREEK BASIN. PROJECT WILL TIE INTO THE EXISTING SANITARY SEWER MAIN.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS TO PROVIDE SEWER CONNECTIONS FOR 78 AGING INDIVIDUAL RESIDENTIAL SEPTIC SYSTEMS, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO LEAD TO RELIABLE AND CLEAN SEWER SERVICE FOR RESIDENTS OF THE TOWN AND THE ELIMINATION OF A SOURCE OF CONTAMINATION FOR THE WATERSHED. CHILDREN RESIDING IN THE AREA AND ATTENDING THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL WILL NOT HAVE TO BE EXPOSED TO SURFACE WATER CONTAMINATION OR INTERRUPTIONS IN THE SCHOOL SCHEDULE DUE TO RISKS OF THE CONTAMINATED GROUNDWATER CLOSING THE SCHOOL FOR REPAIRS OR ENVIRONMENTAL CLEANUPS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO CITY OF COLLEGE PLACE IN WASHINGTON TO IMPLEMENT ITS WASTEWATER TREATMENT UPGRADES PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE THE FOLLOWING: REPLACEMENT OF INFLUENT SCREENS, REPLACEMENT OF GRIT REMOVAL SYSTEM, REHABILITATION OF INFLUENT SCREENS BUILDING, REPLACEMENT OF LEAKING AIR PIPING AT THE EXISTING SEQUENCE BATCH REACTORS (SBRS), IMPROVEMENTS TO PIPING AND REPLACEMENT OF VALVES AT SBR AND FILTER BUILDING, EXPANSION OF EQUALIZATION TANK, REPLACEMENT OF OLD ELECTRICAL PANELS AND PROGRAMMABLE LOGIC CONTROLLERS (PLCS) THROUGHOUT THE PLANT, UPGRADE OF LIGHTING THROUGHOUT THE PLANT, ABANDONMENT OF AN OLD IRRIGATION WELL, MODIFICATIONS TO EXISTING IRRIGATION, AND CONSTRUCTION OF TWO NEW GROUNDWATER MONITORING WELLS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THE SUCCESSFUL CONSTRUCTION OF ALL THE AFOREMENTIONED WASTEWATER TREATMENT ACTIVITIES, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO CITY OF COLLEGE PLACE MEETING NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM (NPDES) PERMIT STANDARDS RELATED TO WATER QUALITY WHICH WILL BENEFIT ITS CITIZENS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL ASSEMBLE A PROJECT MANAGEMENT TEAM; SELECT AND CONTRACT A QUALIFIED DEMOLITION FIRM TO SAFELY DECONSTRUCT THE POLARIS HOTEL AND ANNEX (POLARIS BUILDINGS); AND ADDRESS ASSOCIATED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS (HAZMAT), SAFETY, AND HUMAN HEALTH REQUIREMENTS. THE GOAL IS TO HAVE AN UNENCUMBERED SITE FOR REDEVELOPMENT WITHIN THE NEXT TWO YEARS. ACTIVITIES:THE CITY OF FAIRBANKS (COF) WILL PREPARE AND PUBLISH PUBLIC NOTICES, PREPARE MEETING MATERIALS AND PRESENTATIONS AND PREPARE AND DISTRIBUTE OTHER PUBLIC INFORMATION MATERIALS. THE COF WILL WORK WITH THE CONTRACTOR TO CREATE A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP), ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENT, HEALTH AND SAFETY PLANS (HASPS) AND FINAL CLEANUP PLAN. TO DEMO THE BUILDING THE COF WILL CREATE RFPS FOR CONTRACTOR PROCUREMENT, CONDUCT DEMOLITION OF POLARIS ANNEX, CONDUCT DEMOLITION OF POLARIS HOTEL AND COMPLETE FINAL PERFORMANCE REPORT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:GRANT FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE COF TO SELECT AND CONTRACT A QUALIFIED DEMOLITION FIRM TO SAFELY DECONSTRUCT THE POLARIS HOTEL AND ANNEX (POLARIS BUILDINGS) AND ADDRESS ASSOCIATED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS (HAZMAT), SAFETY, AND HUMAN HEALTH REQUIREMENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND SANITATION CONDITIONS IN THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITIES AND ALASKA NATIVE VILLAGES.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IS THE DEVELOPMENT AND CONSTRUCTION OF WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEMS. DELIVERABLE INCLUDE WATER AND WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE WITH THE OUTCOME OF HAVING SUSTAINABLE UTILITIES MEETING WATER AND WASTEWATER REGULATIONS. ACTIVITIES:THE AWARD WILL FUND THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF WATER AND WASTEWATER FACILITIES IN 10 RURAL AND ALASKA NATIVE COMMUNITIES AND ESTABLISH A CONSTRUCTION RESERVED ACCOUNT TO ADDRESS UNPRECEDENTLY UNPREDICTABLE CONSTRUCTION COSTS.SUBRECIPIENT:PROJECTS IN THE COMMUNITIES OF GULKANA AND GALENA ARE INCLUDED IN THE WORK PLAN.  THESE PROJECTS WILL BE ADMINISTERED BY ANTHC AND GIVEN THE RECENT OIG DETERMINATION THAT ANTHC IS A SUBRECIPIENT THESE PROJECTS ARE CONSIDERED SUBAWARDS UNDER THIS AWARD.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE WATER AND WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE TO PROVIDE SAFE DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER TREATMENT TO PROJECT PUBLIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH OF THE COMMUNITIES RECEIVING INFRASTRUCTURE UNDER THIS AWARD.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THE RURAL UTILITY BUSINESS ADVISOR (RUBA) PROGRAM GRANT WILL ASSIST RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITIES IN BUILDING AND MAINTAINING MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY NEEDED TO SUCCESSFULLY RUN A WATER OR SANITATION UTILITY IN ORDER TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND PROMOTE COMPLIANCE WITH THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT AND THE CLEAN WATER ACT.  THE RUBA TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES AND DELIVERABLES TO RURAL OPERATORS AND COMMUNITIES INCLUDES; 1) ON SITE OVER THE SHOULDER JOB TRAINING IN PROPER UTILITY MANAGEMENT FOR RURAL UTILITY SYSTEMS; 2) CLASS ROOM TRAINING WORKSHOPS ON CRITICAL SKILLS SUCH AS BUDGET DEVELOPMENT, REVENUE COLLECTING AND EXPENSES; 3)  ONE ON ONE TRAINING AND CLASS ROOM TRAINING ON THE SOFTWARE USED STATEWIDE FOR ACCOUNTING FOR RURAL UTILITIES CALLED QUICK BOOKS; 4) FACILITATING REGIONAL WORKSHOPS FOR UTILITY MANAGERS AND PROVIDING CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION TO PREPARE OPERATORS FOR STATE UTILITY MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATION.  THE RECIPIENT'S EFFORTS WILL PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THE DISCHARGE OF UNTREATED WASTEWATER TO AMBIENT WATERS (RIVERS, LAKES, STREAM AND OCEANS), IN ADDITION, THESE OUTCOMES  FURTHER THE DELIVERY OF SAFE DRINKING WATER TO THE PUBLIC BY ENSURING THESE SYSTEMS ARE MANAGED AND OPERATED CORRECTLY.ACTIVITIES:THE RUBA TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES AND DELIVERABLES TO RURAL OPERATORS AND COMMUNITIES INCLUDES; 1) ON SITE OVER THE SHOULDER JOB TRAINING IN PROPER UTILITY MANAGEMENT FOR RURAL UTILITY SYSTEMS; 2) CLASS ROOM TRAINING WORKSHOPS ON CRITICAL SKILLS SUCH AS BUDGET DEVELOPMENT, REVENUE COLLECTING AND EXPENSES; 3)  ONE ON ONE TRAINING AND CLASS ROOM TRAINING ON THE SOFTWARE USED STATEWIDE FOR ACCOUNTING FOR RURAL UTILITIES CALLED QUICK BOOKS; 4) FACILITATING REGIONAL WORKSHOPS FOR UTILITY MANAGERS AND PROVIDING CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION TO PREPARE OPERATORS FOR STATE UTILITY MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATION.  THE RECIPIENT'S EFFORTS WILL PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THE DISCHARGE OF UNTREATED WASTEWATER TO AMBIENT WATERS (RIVERS, LAKES, STREAM AND OCEANS), IN ADDITION, THESE OUTCOMES  FURTHER THE DELIVERY OF SAFE DRINKING WATER TO THE PUBLIC BY ENSURING THESE SYSTEMS ARE MANAGED AND OPERATED CORRECTLY.SUBRECIPIENT:THE PROGRAM PROPOSES A PILOT PROGRAM TO PARTNER WITH A REGIONAL OR STATEWIDE  STAKEHOLDER(S) TO LEVERAGE REGIONAL KNOWLEDGE, CONNECTIONS AND EXPERTISE TO EXPAND SUPPORT FOR UTILITIES AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS IN THE PILOT REGION. THE PILOT PROGRAM IS PROPOSED TO RUN FOR TWO TO THREE GRANT  CYCLES AND BE RE-EVALUATED AT THE END OF THE THIRD GRANT CYCLE.OUTCOMES:THE RUBA PROGRAM SUPPORTS THE MANAGEMENT AND CONTINUED OPERATION OF DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IN RURAL ALASKAN COMMUNITIES.  THE RUBA PROGRAM WORKS WITH COMMUNITIES TO INCREASE THE MANAGERIAL AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY OF THE WATER AND SANITATION UTILITIES. THE OBJECTIVES ARE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CLEAN WATER ACT AND THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACTION SECTION 1420(C)(2) WHICH ADDRESSES THE REQUIREMENTS FOR STATES TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE THE TECHNICAL AND MANAGERIAL AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY OF PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS UNDER THEIR JURISDICTION.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THE REMOTE MAINTENANCE WORKER (RMW) PROGRAM IS TO ASSISTS RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITIES (BENEFICIARIES) IN BUILDING DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEMS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE CAPACITY IN ORDER TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  DELIVERABLES AND ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ON SITE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE SUPPORT AND OVER THE SHOULDER OPERATOR TRAINING RESULTING IN THE OUTCOMES OF ESTABLISH TECHNICAL CAPACITY AND PROMOTE COMPLIANCE WITH THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) AND THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA)ACTIVITIES:THE RMW TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO RURAL OPERATORS AND COMMUNITIES INCLUDES; 1) ON SITE OVER THE SHOULDER JOB TRAINING IN PROPER OPERATION OF WATER AND WASTEWATER TREATMENT FACILITIES AND WATER DISTRIBUTION AND WASTEWATER COLLECTION SYSTEMS; 2) ON SITE ON THE JOB TRAINING WITH THE LOCAL OPERATORS TO IMPROVE TROUBLE SHOOTING, MAINTENANCE, AND MECHANICAL REPAIR SKILLS FOR THE EQUIPMENT SPECIFIC TO EACH COMMUNITY WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEMS; 3)  WITH THE LOCAL OPERATOR DEVELOPING, REVISING AND OR VERIFYING OPERATION AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PLANS TO EXTEND THE LIFE OF THE EQUIPMENT AND REDUCE OPERATIONAL COSTS; 4) WORKING WITH THE LOCAL GOVERNING BODY TO PROVIDE INFORMATION AND THE ACTUAL OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS AND COST OF THE UTILITY; 5) ASSISTING THE OPERATOR IN DEVELOPING AND PRESENTING OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, SAMPLING, MONITORING, AND TESTING REPORTS TO THE GOVERNING BODY CONCERNING STATUS OF THE UTILITY; 6) ASSISTING LOCAL OPERATOR DURING EMERGENCY SITUATIONS WHICH MAY INCLUDE FREEZE-UPS, FLOODS, LEAKS, SEWAGE DISCHARGES OR ANY OTHER SITUATIONS THAT IF NOT ATTENDED TO IMMEDIATELY COULD RESULT IN EXTENDED SERVICE DISRUPTION OR THREAT TO HUMAN HEALTH; 7) TRAINING OPERATOR TO KEEP ACCURATE AND TIMELY RECORDS OF OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE WITHIN THE SYSTEMS, AND; 8) FACILITATING REGIONAL WORKSHOPS FOR OPERATORS AND PROVIDING CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION TO PREPARE OPERATORS FOR STATE CERTIFICATION.  SUBRECIPIENT:FIVE RMW SERVICE AREAS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED, COINCIDING WITH EXISTING REGIONAL HEALTH ORGANIZATION BOUNDARIES. GRANTS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO FUND 11.5 RMWS, PROVIDING SERVICE TO THE 128 VILLAGES LOCATED WITHIN THESE FIVE REGIONAL SERVICE AREAS.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT'S EFFORTS WILL PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THE DISCHARGE OF UNTREATED WASTEWATER TO AMBIENT WATERS (RIVERS, LAKES, STREAM AND OCEANS).  IN ADDITION, THESE EFFORTS FURTHER THE DELIVERY OF SAFE DRINKING WATER TO THE PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THESE FUNDS FOR THE NORTH AMERICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK (NADB) WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO IMPLEMENT THE RECIPIENT'S BORDER ENVIRONMENT INFRASTRUCTURE FUND (BEIF) PROGRAM. THE ACTIVITIES ARE TO PROVIDE GRANT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO NUMEROUS SUBRECIPIENTS FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE CONSTRUCTION AND TRANSITION ASSISTANCE OF THEIR ELIGIBLE SAFE DRINKING WATER AND WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT AND PROTECTION PROJECTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO MANAGE AN EFFECTIVE COMPREHENSIVE BEIF PROGRAM AND TO IMPLEMENT PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS SAFE DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE AND PROTECT WATER QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH FOR CITIZENS THROUGHOUT THE REGION 6 US/MEXICO BORDER AREA UP TO (62 MILES ON EACH SIDE OF THE BORDER). THE NORTH AMERICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK (NADB) WILL USE THE FUNDS TO IMPLEMENT THE BORDER ENVIRONMENT INFRASTRUCTURE FUND (BEIF) PROGRAM IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE OBJECTIVES, RESPONSIBILITIES, AND PROCEDURES DESCRIBED IN THE STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES DATED MAY 2011 OR ITS LATEST REVISION. THE PROJECTS IDENTIFIED IN THE WORK PLAN MEET THE CATEGORY 1 PRIORITY AND WILL BE DEVELOPED BY NADB USING PROJECT DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (PDAP) FUNDING FOR CERTIFICATION. THE NADB WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF SUBAWARDS TO THREE COMMUNITIES IN THE US/MEXICO BORDER AREA FOR THE AWARD OF CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTS AND IMPLEMENT THE CONSTRUCTION OF DRINKING WATER AND/OR WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE FOR ITS SERVICE AREAS. ANTHONY, NM WILL IMPLEMENT A WATER STORAGE AND DISTRIBUTION EXPANSION PROJECT; NUEVO LAREDO, MEXICO WILL IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE WASTEWATER COLLECTION AND TREATMENT REHABILITATION; AND SUNLAND PARK, NM THROUGH ITS WATER AND WASTEWATER UTILITY PROVIDER (CAMINO REAL REGIONAL UTILITY AUTHORITY) WILL IMPLEMENT A WASTEWATER COLLECTION SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT. OVER 22,415 HOUSEHOLDS IN THE THREE BORDER COMMUNITIES (ANTHONY, NM; NUEVO LAREDO, MEXICO; AND SUNLAND PARK, NM) WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER SERVICES. IN ADDITION, RESIDENTS IN THE COMMUNITY OF LAREDO, TEXAS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ELIMINATION OF RAW OR INADEQUATELY TREATED WASTEWATER DISCHARGES FROM MEXICAN COMMUNITIES TO THE RIO GRANDE LEADING TO THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE WATER QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:THE NADB WILL OVERSEE AND ADMINISTER THE IMPLEMENTATION OF CONSTRUCTION AND/OR TRANSITION ASSISTANCE TO THREE COMMUNITIES IN ANTHONY, NM; NUEVO LAREDO, TAMAULIPAS, MEXICO; AND SUNLAND PARK, NM.  THE COMMUNITIES THROUGH SUBAWARDS WILL PROCURE AND ISSUE CONSTRUCTION OVERSIGHT AND CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTS TO IMPLEMENT HIGH PRIORITY DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER PROJECTS TO BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS IN EACH COMMUNITY AND FOR THE NUEVO LAREDO, TAMAULIPAS TO HAVE A DIRECT TRANSBOUNDARY BENEFIT TO THE US COMMUNITY OF LAREDO, TEXAS.  SUBRECIPIENT:THE COMMUNITIES WILL PROCURE AND AWARD CONSTRUCTION OVERSIGHT AND CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTS TO IMPLEMENT THE CONSTRUCTION OF HIGH PRIORITY DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER PROJECTS TO BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS.   OUTCOMES:THE NADB WILL PROVIDE PROGRESS CONSTRUCTION SCHEDULES ON A MONTHLY BASIS AND ONGOING AND PROJECTED PROJECT DISBURSEMENTS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS AS PART OF THEIR OVERSIGHT AND PROJECT ADMINISTRATION.  AS PART OF THE NADB'S OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES, MONTHLY AND QUARTERLY SCHEDULES AND REPORTS WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE EPA REGION 6 TO DEMONSTRATE PROJECT PROGRESS.  OVER 22,415 HOUSEHOLDS IN THE THREE BORDER COMMUNITIES (ANTHONY, NM; NUEVO LAREDO, MEXICO; AND SUNLAND PARK, NM) WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER SERVICES. IN ADDITION, RESIDENTS IN THE COMMUNITY OF LAREDO, TEXAS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ELIMINATION OF RAW OR INADEQUATELY TREATED WASTEWATER DISCHARGES FROM MEXICAN COMMUNITIES TO THE RIO GRANDE LEADING TO THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE WATER QUALITY.

THE PURPOSE OF THE REMOTE MAINTENANCE WORKER (RMW) PROGRAM IS TO ASSISTS RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITIES (BENEFICIARIES) IN BUILDING DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEMS OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE CAPACITY IN ORDER TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  DELIVERABLES AND ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ON SITE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE SUPPORT AND OVER THE SHOULDER OPERATOR TRAINING RESULTING IN THE OUTCOMES OF ESTABLISHING TECHNICAL CAPACITY AND PROMOTING COMPLIANCE WITH THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) AND THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA)

THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND SANITATION CONDITIONS IN THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITIES AND ALASKA NATIVE VILLAGES.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IS THE DEVELOPMENT AND CONSTRUCTION OF WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEMS. DELIVERABLE INCLUDE WATER AND WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE WITH THE OUTCOME OF HAVING SUSTAINABLE UTILITIES MEETING WATER AND WASTEWATER REGULATIONS.

THE PURPOSE OF THE RURAL UTILITY BUSINESS ADVISOR (RUBA) PROGRAM GRANT WILL ASSIST RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITIES IN BUILDING AND MAINTAINING MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY NEEDED TO SUCCESSFULLY RUN A WATER OR SANITATION UTILITY IN ORDER TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND PROMOTE COMPLIANCE WITH THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT AND THE CLEAN WATER ACT.  THE RUBA&NBSPANDTRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES AND DELIVERABLES TO RURAL OPERATORS AND COMMUNITIES INCLUDESAND 1) ON SITE OVER THE SHOULDER JOB TRAINING IN PROPER UTILITY MANAGEMENT FOR RURAL UTILITY SYSTEMSAND 2) CLASS ROOM TRAINING WORKSHOPS ON CRITICAL SKILLS SUCH AS BUDGET DEVELOPMENT, REVENUE COLLECTING AND EXPENSESAND 3)&NBSPAND ONE ON ONE TRAINING AND CLASS ROOM TRAINING ON THE SOFTWARE USED STATEWIDE FOR ACCOUNTING FOR RURAL UTILITIES CALLED QUICK BOOKSAND 4) FACILITATING REGIONAL WORKSHOPS FOR UTILITY MANAGERS&NBSPANDAND PROVIDING CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION TO PREPARE OPERATORS FOR STATE UTILITY MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATION.&NBSPAND THE RECIPIENT&RSQUOANDS EFFORTS WILL PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THE DISCHARGE OF UNTREATED WASTEWATER TO AMBIENT WATERS (RIVERS, LAKES, STREAM AND OCEANS), IN ADDITION, THESE OUTCOMES  FURTHER THE DELIVERY OF SAFE DRINKING WATER TO THE PUBLIC BY ENSURING THESE SYSTEMS ARE MANAGED AND OPERATED CORRECTLY.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT IS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THAT IS PROVIDED WATER AND WASTEWATER SERVICES FROM THE SYSTEMS ASSISTED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT

THE TARGETED AIR SHED (TAS) PROJECT FOR LOGAN UT/ID CACHE VALLEY COMMUNITY IS PART OF EPA'S 2016 TAS GRANT PROGRAM. THE PROJECT WILL REDUCE PM2.5 AIR POLLUTION IN THE LOGAN UT/ID PM2.5 NONATTAINMENT AREA BY REDUCING EMISSIONS FROM ROAD DUST, WOOD COMBUSTION, AND TRANSPORTATION SOURCES. STRATEGIES INCLUDE WOOD STOVE CHANGE-OUTS, HOME WEATHERIZATION, REDUCING ROAD SANDING WITH THE USE OF SALT AND BRINE, INSTALLATION OF STAGE I VAPOR RECOVERY IN GAS STATIONS, AND THE CAPITAL PURCHASE OF BUSES. COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION WILL ADD TO THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO LAKE COUNTY PUBLIC WORKS TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO FUND PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING TO DESIGN PHASE 2 OF THE DES PLAINES RIVER WATER RECLAMATION FACILITY (DPR WRF) PRESS AND POLYMER EQUIPMENT REPLACEMENT PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE FOR ONLY THE PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING PHASE OF THE PROJECT TO REPLACE THE EXISTING BELT FILTER PRESSES AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT IN THE SLUDGE DEWATERING WITH NEW CENTRIFUGES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE A PRELIMINARY AND FINAL ENGINEERING DESIGN WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO HELP WITH COMPLETION OF THE PHASE 2 PROJECT TO IMPROVE THE DES PLAINES RIVER WATER RECLAMATION FACILITY BY REPLACING AND UPGRADING CRITICAL DEWATERING EQUIPMENT FOR RESIDENTS OF LAKE COUNTY, IL.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF ASSUMPTION TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT FOR FUNCTIONAL REPLACEMENTS AND CONSTRUCTION WITHIN THE EXISTING WATER TREATMENT PLANT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REMOVING AND REPLACING THE CURRENT FILTER AND SOFTENER WITHIN THE PLANT WITH THREE NEW PROPOSED FILTERS, TWO SOFTENERS AND TWO NITRATE REMOVAL VESSELS. THE ADDITION OF A NEW NITRATE REMOVAL SYSTEM IN THE EXISTING PLANT CAUSES INSUFFICIENT ROOM FOR THESE NEW UNITS IN THE EXISTING BUILDING. THEREFORE, A NEW BUILDING OF APPROXIMATELY 80FT X 40FT (3,200 SQ FT) FLOOR AREA WILL BE CONSTRUCTED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE EXISTING BUILDING. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE REMOVING AND REPLACING THE CURRENT FILTER AND SOFTENER WITHIN THE PLANT WITH THREE NEW PROPOSED FILTERS, TWO SOFTENERS AND TWO NITRATE REMOVAL VESSELS. THE NEW NITRATE REMOVAL SYSTEM WILL BE HOUSED IN A NEW BUILDING ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE EXISTING BUILDING. THE PROJECT ONCE COMPLETED WILL MEET THE AVERAGE DAY AND PEAK DAY DEMANDS OF THEIR WATER CUSTOMERS WHILE STAYING IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH ALL REGULATORY WATER TREATMENT REQUIREMENTS FOR RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF ASSUMPTION

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF RUSHVILLE TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT FOR FUNCTIONAL REPLACEMENTS AND CONSTRUCTION AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO PERFORMED INCLUDE FUNCTIONAL REPLACEMENTS AND CONSTRUCTION OF A WATER TANK, REPLACEMENT OF INOPERABLE VALVES AND HYDRANTS, CREATION OF A WATER TREATMENT PLANT EMERGENCY BYPASS, AND A GROUND STORAGE TANK REPLACEMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES WILL BE UPDATED DRINKING WATER INFRASTRUCTURE, INCLUDING A NEW BYPASS LINE AT THE WATER TREATMENT PLANT THAT WILL ASSIST IN ANY FUTURE NEEDED MAINTENANCE AT THE PLANT. ONCE THE PROJECT IS COMPLETE THE CITY OF RUSHVILLE WILL HAVE A CLEANER, MORE RELIABLE WATER SUPPLY FOR ITS RESIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF JOLIET TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO REPLACE DETERIORATED AND UNDERSIZED WATERS MAINS IN THE CITY OF JOLIET AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE ALL WORK NECESSARY TO INSTALL THE WATER MAIN, INSTALL WATER SERVICE LINES VIA DIRECTIONAL DRILLING OR OPEN CUT METHODS, RECONNECT EXISTING WATER SERVICE LINES, RESTORE THE ROADWAY, AND PERFORM ALL RESTORATION TO RETURN THE AREA TO ITS ORIGINAL CONDITION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE REDUCED WATER LOSS AND REMOVAL OF LEAD SERVICE LINES FROM THE CITY'S DRINKING WATER SYSTEM WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO IMPROVED RELIABILITY AND EFFICIENCY OF THE SYSTEM AND FOR RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF JOLIET.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO WAUKESHA WATER UTILITY TO IMPLEMENT ITS SMALLER PROJECT TO ERECT A NEW ELEVATED WATER TOWER AS PART OF A LARGER PROJECT TO CONNECT TO LAKE MICHIGAN WATER SUPPLY AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE SUPPLY COSTS FOR ERECTION OF A NEW ELEVATED STORAGE TANK.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE A OPERATIONAL ELEVATED WATER STORAGE TOWER, THAT WILL PROVIDE SAFE AND SUSTAINABLE WATER SUPPLY FOR THE CITY OF WAUKESHA'S SERVICE AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO STRONGSVILLE, OHIO TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT FOR THE PROSPECT ROAD STORM SEWER PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE PROSPECT ROAD STORM SEWER PROJECT IS LOCATED IN CUYAHOGA COUNTY, CITY OF STRONGSVILLE ON PROSPECT ROAD FROM APPROXIMATELY 400' NORTH OF ALBION ROAD TO BLODGETT CREEK, WHICH IS 500' SOUTH OF FAIR ROAD. THE CONSTRUCTION CONSISTS OF THE REPLACEMENT OF AN EXISTING INADEQUATE AND DEFICIENT STORM SEWER SYSTEM AND APPURTENANCES WITH NEW STORM SEWERS RANGING FROM 12' TO 48' IN DIAMETER, MANHOLES AND CATCH BASINS. THE PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES THE RESTORATION OF DISTURBED AREAS AS WELL AS PAVEMENT REPAIRS INCLUDING MILLING EXISTING ASPHALT, FULL DEPTH BASE REPAIRS AND NEW ASPHALT INTERMEDIATE SURFACE COURSES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS AND A FINAL PROJECT REPORT OUTLINING THE PROGRESS OF THE CONSTRUCTION PROJECT. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO ELIMINATE FLOODING IN THE AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE GEAUGA COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF WATER RESOURCES (GCDWR) TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO RENOVATE AND UPGRADE THE MCFARLAND WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT (WWTP) AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:GCDWR INTENDS TO USE THIS FUNDING TO PURCHASE THE EQUIPMENT NEEDED TO UPGRADE THE MCFARLAND WWTP.  THEY WILL PURCHASE:

- MECHANICAL SCREENING PACKAGE
- GRIT REMOVAL PACKAGE
- 2 SUMP PUMPS
-NON-POTABLE WATER BOOSTER PUMP
- 3 INFLUENT PUMPS
- 2 EQ PUMPS; AND
