DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE TOWN OF NEWPORT, NH TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO RENOVATE THE WASTEWATER TREATMENT FACILITY AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE DEMOLITION; REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING INFLUENT PUMPING AND FLOW MEASUREMENT SYSTEMS, GRIT REMOVAL SYSTEM AND FACILITY ELECTRICAL SERVICE AND STANDBY GENERATOR; CONVERT THE EXISTING AERATED LAGOONS TO INFLUENT EQUALIZATION BASINS AND LAGOON PUMP STATION; CONSTRUCT TWO NEW SBRS WITH TWO POST-SBR/EFFLUENT EQUALIZATION TANKS INCLUDING THREE AERATION BLOWERS; CONSTRUCT TWO NEW SLUDGE HOLDING TANKS AND ASSOCIATED SLUDGE MIXING SYSTEMS AND DECANT CAPABILITIES FOR SLUDGE THICKENING; PROVIDE A NEW SLUDGE DEWATERING SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED APPURTENANCES; CONSTRUCT A NEW PROCESS BUILDING; RETROFIT EXISTING TERTIARY FILTRATION SYSTEM WITH TWO NEW CLOTH-DISC STYLE FILTERS WITHIN THE EXISTING FILTER BASINS AND A NEW FERRIC CHLORIDE CHEMICAL FEED SYSTEM; RENOVATE EXISTING CONTROL BUILDING AND TERTIARY BUILDING; UPGRADE THE EXISTING UV DISINFECTION SYSTEM INCLUDING A NEW UV BUILDING; AND COMPLETE MISCELLANEOUS CIVIL, ARCHITECTURAL, STRUCTURAL, MECHANICAL/HVAC, PLUMBING, INSTRUMENTATION AND ELECTRICAL IMPROVEMENTS AS NEEDED TO SUPPORT THE NEW EQUIPMENT AND BUILDING SYSTEMS..SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THE NEW TREATMENT FACILITY TO ACHIEVE COMPLIANCE WITH THE NPDES PERMIT, WHICH BECAME EFFECTIVE SEPTEMBER 1, 2020, CONTAINING NEW AMMONIA NITROGEN AND VARIOUS METALS EFFLUENT LIMITS, EXISTING TOTAL PHOSPHORUS LIMITS, AND NEW MONITORING/OPTIMIZATION OF TOTAL NITROGEN REMOVAL REQUIREMENT, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO IMPROVED LONG-TERM WATER QUALITY IN THE SUGAR RIVER AND DOWNSTREAM WATER BODIES AS WELL AS IMPROVED RELIABILITY OF WASTEWATER TREATMENT SYSTEMS FOR THE TOWN OF NEWPORT OVER THE 20-YEAR PLANNING PERIOD FOR THE CITIZENS OF THE TOWN OF NEWPORT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE ADDISON COUNTY COMMUNITY TRUST TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO PROVIDE FOR WASTEWATER COLLECTION AND TREATMENT IMPROVEMENTS IN THE LINDALE MOBILE HOME PARK AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INVOLVE THE CONSTRUCTION AND INSTALLATION OF A NEW COMMUNITY WASTEWATER SEPTIC SYSTEM TO TREAT DOMESTIC SEWAGE FROM THE LINDALE MOBILE HOME PARK.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THROUGH THE INSTALLATION OF THE NEW COMMUNITY SEPTIC SYSTEM, THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS IMPROVED WASTEWATER QUALITY FOR THE RESIDENTS OF THE MOBILE HOME PARK AS WELL AS THE SURROUNDING NATURAL ENVIRONMENT WHICH IS EXPECTED TO LEAD TO AN IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE EXISTING RESIDENTS LIVING WITHIN THE PARK PROPERTY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO UPGRADE THE EXISTING ANSON MADISON WASTEWATER TREATMENT FACILITY AND ITS PROCESSES TO ENABLE THE REMOVAL OF PFAS COMPOUNDS.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE THE REPLACEMENT OF TREATMENT PLANT PROCESSES AND PIPING, AS WELL AS A BRIDGING OF THE MADISON SIDE OF THE PLANT TO THE TREATMENT LAGOONS OF THE ANSON SIDE. THE PROJECT WILL UPGRADE THE FACILITY'S TREATMENT SYSTEM TO ENABLE REMOVAL OF PFAS IN WASTEWATER EFFLUENT AND SLUDGE RESIDUALS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE A TOTAL UPGRADE TO THE TREATMENT FACILITIES WHICH WILL IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF WASTEWATER EFFLUENT FOR PEOPLE SERVED BY WASTEWATER FACILITIES FOR
THE TOWNS OF ANSON AND MADISON, MAINE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CITY OF PRESQUE ISLE, MAINE TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO BUILD AN ECHO LAKE SEPTIC TANK EFFLUENT PUMP SYSTEM AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE THE REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING SEPTIC SYSTEMS ALONG ECHO LAKE ROAD WITH A MINOR UPGRADE TO A SEPTIC TANK EFFLUENT PUMP (STEP) SYSTEM.  
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE A NEW SEPTIC SYSTEM SERVING THE RESIDENTS OF ECHO LAKE ROAD, SEPTIC LIFT STATIONS, REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING SEPTIC EFFLUENT DISPOSAL FIELDS AND A NEW SEPTIC TANK PUMP. PROJECT COMPONENTS WILL INCLUDE A SEPTIC TANK EFFLUENT PUMPING SYSTEM (STEP) SYSTEM.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY OF THE PROJECT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF ECHO LAKE ROAD IN PRESQUE ISLE, MAINE, AND THE WATER QUALITY OF ECHO LAKE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE TYNGSBOROUGH SEWER COMMISSION TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO OBTAIN A FULL SET OF FINAL DESIGN PLANS AND DRAWINGS FOR FUTURE SEWER PHASES, AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE FINAL DESIGN OF MULTIPLE PHASES OF THE SEWER SYSTEM, INCLUDING PROJECT MANAGEMENT. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE:

DRAFT PUMP STATION DESIGN BASIS REPORT
FINAL PUMP STATION DESIGN BASIS REPORT
60% DELIVERABLE (DRAWINGS AND COST ESTIMATE)
90% DELIVERABLE (FULL CONTRACT DOCUMENTS - DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS AND UPDATED COST ESTIMATE)    
100% DELIVERABLE (FULL CONTRACT DOCUMENTS - DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS AND UPDATED COST ESTIMATE) 

WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO A FUNDABLE SEWER CONSTRUCTION PROJECT VIA THE MASSACHUSETTS CWSRF TO IMPROVE PUBLIC HEALTH AND WATER QUALITY FOR THE RESIDENTS OF TYNGSBOROUGH AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE TOWN OF MEDWAY, MASSACHUSETTS TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT FOR THE CIVIL, SITE, AND CONCRETE WORK ASSOCIATED WITH THE CENTRAL WATER TREATMENT FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE THE CIVIL AND SITE WORK AND CONCRETE WORK ASSOCIATED WITH THE DRINKING WATER TREATMENT PLANT. THE TREATMENT PLANT WILL REMOVE IRON AND MANGANESE FROM THREE WELL SOURCES IN THE COMMUNITY, UTILIZING A GREENSANDPLUS TM PRESSURE FILTRATION SYSTEM AND CHEMICAL ADDITION. THE CONSTRUCTION INCLUDES FEATURES ALLOWING FOR EASY ADDITION OF TREATMENT SYSTEMS FOR FUTURE PFAS TREATMENT EQUIPMENT, INCLUDING PROVISIONAL SPACE FOR EQUIPMENT, AND ANCILLARY EQUIPMENT AND CONTROLS. THE CIVIL AND SITE WORK INCLUDES DEMOLITION FOR A WALL AND GARAGE THAT WERE ON SITE, EARTHWORK AND EXCAVATION OF THE SITE, DUCTILE PIPING AND FITTINGS (BURIED APPLICATIONS), AND CONCRETE IN PLACE CONCRETE FOR FOOTINGS, SLABS, INTERIOR WALLS AND EXTERIOR WALLS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE A NEW DRINKING WATER TREATMENT PLANT, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO LEAD TO SAFER DRINKING WATER WITH TREATMENT REMOVING IRON AND MANGANESE FROM THREE WELL SOURCES IN THE COMMUNITY FOR ALL RESIDENTS OF THE TOWN OF MEDWAY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE TOWN OF HULL TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO REPLACE THE TOWN OF HULL PUMP STATION 9 AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED AS DESCRIBED IN THE WORKPLAN ARE: THE HULL PUMP STATION 9 PROJECT WILL REPLACE THE CURRENT DETERIORATED STATION, WHICH IS WELL BEYOND ITS USEFUL LIFE, WITH A NEW STATION THAT MEETS ALL CURRENT CODES, AS WELL AS ADDRESSES CLIMATE CHANGE/RESILIENCY MEASURES. THE COMMUNITY DESIGNATED FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE CONSTRUCTION PHASE OF THE PROJECT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS TO REPLACE THE CURRENT DETERIORATED STATION, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO TO INCREASE RESILIENCY, IMPROVE ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND RESTORE RELIABILITY FOR PUMP STATION 9 FOR RESIDENTS OF THE TOWN OF HULL.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO CHARLES RIVER WATERSHED ASSOCIATION TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO DEVELOP A CHARLES RIVER FLOOD MODEL AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL INCLUDE UPDATING AND ENHANCING THE CHARLES RIVER FLOOD MODEL (CRFM) TO MAINTAIN ITS UTILITY AS AN EFFECTIVE CLIMATE PLANNING TOOL FOR THE WATERSHED, AS WELL AS INTEGRATING COMPLEMENTARY DATA AND/OR ADJACENT MODELING EFFORTS AS NEEDED.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS A COMPREHENSIVE COMPUTER MODEL OF THE MIDDLE AND UPPER CHARLES RIVER WATERSHED THAT INCORPORATES ALL NECESSARY ELEMENTS AND DATA TO EFFECTIVELY PREDICT FUTURE FLOODING FROM PRECIPITATION EVENTS.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO PRIORITIZE FLOOD MITIGATION PROJECTS AND STRATEGIES WHICH WILL BENEFIT THE CHARLES RIVER WATERSHED AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS BEING AWARDED FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,280,000 TO THE TOWN OF IPSWICH TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECTS TO REPLACE THE TOWN HILL WATER STORAGE TANK AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE: 
* CONSTRUCTION OF THE NEW WATER STORAGE TANK ADJACENT TO THE EXISTING STORAGE TANK
*  DEMOLITION OF THE EXISTING STEEL TANK AFTER NEW TANK IS COMPLETED AND ONLINE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES IS THE INSTALLATION OF A NEW WATER STORAGE TANK WHICH IS EXPECTED TO IMPROVE THE POTABLE DRINKING WATER SUPPLY FOR THE CUSTOMERS OF THE IPSWICH, MASSACHUSETTS DRINKING WATER SYSTEM AND MEET CURRENT MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH GUIDELINES FOR WATER STORAGE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS BEING AWARDED FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,360,000 TO THE CITY OF MALDEN TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO REPLACE LEAD SERVICE LINES (LSLS) AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT. AS OF NOVEMBER 2022, THE CITY OF MALDEN HAS 2,348 CONNECTIONS CONFIRMED TO BE MADE OF LEAD (ON EITHER PUBLIC, PRIVATE, OR BOTH SIDES) AND AN ADDITIONAL 1,889 METERED CONNECTIONS (AGAIN EITHER PUBLIC, PRIVATE, OR BOTH SIDES) MADE OF AN UNKNOWN MATERIAL. THE PROJECT WILL TAKE PLACE ON PUBLIC RIGHT OF WAYS (CITY STREETS) AND ON PRIVATE PROPERTY WHERE LEAD SERVICE LINES ARE PRESENT. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED OVER THE FOUR YEAR PROGRAM WILL BE THE REPLACEMENT OF APPROXIMATELY 100-120 LEAD SERVICE LINES PER YEAR FOR A TOTAL OF APPROXIMATELY 450 LINES REPLACED. HOMES AND STREETS TARGETED WITH THIS FUNDING WILL BE SELECTED BY THE RISK FOR YEARS OF CHILD LEAD EXPOSURE. HOUSES WITH MORE CHILDREN AND FEWER FINANCIAL RESOURCES WILL BE PRIORITIZED FOR LEAD LINE REMOVAL REMOVAL.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE 450 SUCCESSFUL LEAD SERVICE LINE REPLACEMENTS OVER THE NEXT FOUR YEARS. BETWEEN THE CITY'S ONGOING LEAD LINE REMOVAL PROGRAM AND THE ADDITIONAL FUNDING FROM THIS AGREEMENT, MALDEN WILL BE ABLE TO REPLACE NEARLY HALF OF ALL CONFIRMED LEAD SERVICE LINES IN THE CITY OVER THE NEXT FOUR YEARS ON BOTH THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SIDES OF THE ASSETS. THIS IS EXPECTED TO LEAD TO A SIGNIFICANT REDUCTION IN THE NUMBER OF CHILDHOOD LEAD EXPOSURES AND IMPROVED HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR MALDEN'S RESIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE TOWN OF MANCHESTER TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO REMOVE AGING WATER AND SANITARY SEWER INFRASTRUCTURE AND REPLACE ANY LEAD SERVICES OR GOOSENECKS THAT WERE INSTALLED BEFORE LEAD PROHIBITIONS WENT INTO EFFECT AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE APPROXIMATELY 5,000 FEET OF WATER MAIN AND 4,600 FEET OF SANITARY SEWER MAIN WILL BE REPLACED IN THE CHESTNUT STREET/LINDEN STREET NEIGHBORHOOD WILL BE COMPLETED IN TWO PHASES. THE FIRST PHASE (FUNDED VIA THIS GRANT OPPORTUNITY) WILL RESULT IN THE REPLACEMENT OF WATER AND SANITARY SEWER LINES IN THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE NEIGHBORHOOD, INCLUDING SERVICES TO THE MARY CHENEY LIBRARY AND THE PROBATE COURT, WHICH CURRENTLY UTILIZE CROSS COUNTRY MAINS. OTHER ANCILLARY WORK WILL ALSO BE COMPLETED, INCLUDING: THE INSTALLATION OF WATER SERVICES, FIRE HYDRANTS, PRIVATE SANITARY SEWER LATERALS, THE ABANDONMENT OF EXISTING SANITARY AND WATER UTILITIES, MINOR STORM DRAINAGE IMPROVEMENTS, THE INSTALLATION OF EXTRUDED CONCRETE CURB, MINOR SIDEWALK RESTORATION, SURFACE RESTORATION, AND RELATED TRAFFIC CONTROL.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THE REPLACEMENT OF APPROXIMATELY 5,000 LINEAR FEED OF POTENTIALLY LEAD WATER MAIN, THE REPLACEMENT OF APPROXIMATELY 4,600 LINEAR FEET OF POTENTIALLY LEAD SEWER MAIN, AND DECREASING THE AVERAGE AGE OF THE WATER AND SEWER INFRASTRUCTURE IN MANCHESTER, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO THE REDUCTION OF MEASURABLE LEAD LEVELS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD, THE IMPROVEMENT OF WATER QUALITY FOR RESIDENTS, INCREASE THE PERCENTAGE OF PIPES REPLACED WITHIN THE LAST 5 YEARS, AND DECREASE THE NUMBER OF ANNUAL SEWER BACKUPS AND WATER MAIN BREAKS ACROSS THE ENTIRE SYSTEM FOR ENSURING SAFE DRINKING WATER AND RELIABLE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE BY REPLACING OLD WATER AND SEWER MAINS THAT WERE INSTALLED BEFORE THE PROHIBITION OF LEAD MATERIALS, IN A DISADVANTAGED AREA IN MANCHESTER.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT IS BEING AWARDED FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,000,000 TO THE TOWN OF HOPEDALE, MASSACHUSETTS TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO INSTALL A WATER STORAGE TANK AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE INSTALLATION OF A SECOND STANDPIPE WATER STORAGE TANK TO PROVIDE THE REQUIRED STORAGE AND ADDITIONAL REDUNDANCY AT THE APPROPRIATE PRESSURE. THE WATER TANK INSTALLATION WILL INCLUDE NECESSARY EXCAVATION, FOUNDATION, AND SITE WORK, CONSTRUCTION OF THE NEW TANK AND APPURTENANCES, AND MISCELLANEOUS ELECTRICAL AND INSTRUMENTATION WORK. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE INSTALLATION OF A WATER STORAGE TANK, INCLUDING NECESSARY EXCAVATION, FOUNDATION, SITE WORK, ELECTRICAL WORK TO POWER IN-TANK MECHANICAL MIXER AND LIGHTING, AND INSTRUMENTATION EQUIPMENT TO ALLOW THE TANK TO CONNECT TO THE TOWN'S SCADA SYSTEM, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO ADDITIONAL EMERGENCY STORAGE AND REDUNDANT FIRE FLOW STORAGE AND STORAGE AT THE APPROPRIATE PRESSURE WITHIN THE WATER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM ALLOWING FOR A GREATER TURNOVER RATE IN THE EXISTING WATER TANK FOR THE CITIZENS OF THE TOWN OF HOPEDALE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO CITY OF BREWER TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO REMEDIATE THE OAK GROVE SEWER SUB-SYSTEM AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE TO RELINE OR REPLACE UNDERGROUND SANITARY SEWER THAT HAS BEEN OBSERVED TO BE DETERIORATED. LINES THAT ARE NOT IMPROPERLY SIZED AND THAT ARE OBSERVED TO BE SUITABLE FOR LINING WILL BE REHABILITATED USING TRENCHLESS LINING TECHNOLOGY. MANHOLES WILL BE REPLACED AND WILL BE INSTALLED AT REGULAR INTERVALS OR AT PIPE INTERSECTIONS AND ENDS OF MAINS. REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING SEWER SERVICES WILL BE INSTALLED FROM THE NEW MAIN TO THE RIGHT-OF-WAY LINE FOR EACH PROPERTY ALONG THE PROJECT ROUTE. FOLLOWING INSTALLATION, SURFACE RESTORATION WILL BE COMPLETED.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE APPROXIMATELY 5,250 FEET OF NEW SEWER REPLACED OR REHABILITATED IN THE OAK GROVE PROJECT AREA ALONG WITH 25 MANHOLES AND APPROXIMATELY 2,000 LINEAR FEET OF REHABILITATED SANITARY SEWER SERVICES, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO IMPROVE THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENT AND DECREASE RISKS TO PUBLIC HEALTH BY REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF UNTREATED SEWAGE THAT ESCAPES TO THE ENVIRONMENT AS COMBINED SEWER OVERFLOWS ALONG WITH STORMWATER FLOWS DURING PRECIPITATION EVENTS FOR THE CITIZENS OF THE CITY OF BREWER IN THE OAK GROVE AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE PRUDENCE ISLAND WATER DISTRICT TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT FOR SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF PERMANENT DISINFECTION AT THE TWO EXISTING WELL SITES. TWO TREATMENT SYSTEMS ARE BEING INSTALLED: (1) DISINFECTION AND IRON AND MANGANESE FACILITIES AT THE INDIAN SPRINGS WELL SITE AND (2) DISINFECTION FACILITIES AT THE ARMY CAMP WELL SITE. THE PROPOSED TREATMENT SYSTEM INCLUDES CONVERTING THE EXISTING PUMP STATION TO A CHLORINE ADDITION FACILITY WHICH WILL BE USED FOR STORING AND DOSING CHLORINE. THE FACILITIES AT THE INDIAN SPRINGS WELL SITE CONSIST OF TWO CHLORINE PUMPS, A 1-GALLON DAY TANK, AND A CONTAMINANT PALLET. SEVERAL HUNDRED FEET OF EXISTING 4-INCH WATER MAIN WILL BE REPLACED WITH 8-INCH DIAMETER DUCTILE IRON WATER MAIN TO PROVIDE CONTACT TIME FOR THE CHLORINE ADDITION. A PRE-ENGINEERED 2-FILTER GREENSAND FILTRATION SYSTEM WILL BE INSTALLED FOR IRON AND MANGANESE TREATMENT. THE PROPOSED DISINFECTION SYSTEM AT THE ARMY CAMP WELL SITE WILL BE CONVERTING THAT EXISTING PUMP STATION TO A CHLORINE ADDITION FACILITY USED FOR STORING AND DOSING CHLORINE. THE FACILITY WILL CONSIST OF 2 CHLORINE PUMPS, A CARBOY SCALE, AND A CONTAMINANT PALLET. EXISTING 2-INCH WATER MAIN WILL BE REPLACED WITH 16-INCH DIAMETER DUCTILE IRON WATER MAIN TO PROVIDE CONTACT TIME FOR THE CHLORINE ADDITION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE TREATMENT SYSTEMS INCLUDING CHLORINATION AND IRON AND MANGANESE REMOVAL, WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND ENSURE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE WATER SYSTEM INTO THE FUTURE FOR CUSTOMERS OF THE PRUDENCE ISLAND WATER DISTRICT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO LIVERMORE FALLS TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO PROVIDE WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT IMPROVEMENTS AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW SLUDGE HOLDING TANK AND PRIMARY CLARIFIERS AT THE TREATMENT PLANT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE INCREASED TREATMENT PLANT EFFICIENCY AND REDUNDANCY AT THE WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT WHICH ARE EXPECTED TO LEAD TO IMPROVED WATER QUALITY TO MEET THE WASTEWATER TREATMENT NEEDS FOR THE RESIDENTS OF LIVERMORE FALLS AND JAY, MAINE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO CITY OF WEST HAVEN TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR THE POSSIBLE ADDITION OF A BIO-DIGESTION FACILITY AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT OR AS IDENTIFIED IN AN APPROVED TECHNICAL CORRECTION IF ONE HAS BEEN APPROVED FOR THIS PROJECT.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE LIMITED TO A FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR THE POSSIBLE ADDITION OF A BIO-DIGESTION FACILITY. THE CITY WILL HIRE A PROFESSIONAL ENGINEERING FIRM WITH EXPERTISE IN SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT AND SLUDGE MANAGEMENT TO EXPLORE OPTIONS AVAILABLE AND DEVELOP A PROJECT BUDGET.  THE CONSIDERATIONS TO BE STUDIED WILL INCLUDE: 1.) CONTRACTING WITH A THIRD PARTY BIO-DIGESTION CONTRACTOR; 2.) CONSTRUCTING A MUNICIPAL BIO-DIGESTER LARGE ENOUGH TO ONLY HANDLE WEST HAVEN SLUDGE; 3.) CONSTRUCTING A BIO-DIGESTER LARGE ENOUGH TO HANDLE WEST HAVEN ORGANIC WASTE (FOOD AND YARD); 4.) CONSTRUCTING A BIO-DIGESTER LARGE ENOUGH TO BECOME A REGIONAL SLUDGE AND ORGANIC WASTE DISPOSAL SOLUTION; AND 5.) ADDING COGENERATION OF ELECTRICITY PRODUCED FROM METHANE BY-PRODUCT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE A COMPLETED FEASIBILITY STUDY, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO LEAD TO A CAPITAL PROJECT FOR THE CITIZENS OF WEST HAVEN, CT AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE TOWN OF BETHEL, CT TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROJECT TO INSTALL A NEW PUBLIC DRINKING WATER SOURCE AND TREATMENT FACILITY AS DIRECTED IN THE 2022 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT.ACTIVITIES:THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE INSTALLATION OF A NEW 800 GALLON PER MINUTE DRINKING WATER WELL AND TREATMENT BUILDING, LOW PRESSURE FILTRATION SYSTEM, BACKWASH AND RECYCLE BACKWASH SYSTEMS, CHEMICAL TREATMENT SYSTEMS, ASSOCIATED ELECTRICAL AND INSTRUMENTATION EQUIPMENT, BACKUP EMERGENCY GENERATOR, FINISHED WATER MAIN AND SANITARY FORCE MAINS.  THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN A NEW PUBLIC DRINKING WATER SOURCE THAT WILL ALLOW SIGNIFICANT OPERATIONAL FLEXIBILITY TO IMPROVE THE ABILITY OF THE BETHEL WATER DEPARTMENT TO MEET ITS CURRENT AND FUTURE DEMAND.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THE INSTALLATION OF A NEW DRINKING WATER SOURCE AND TREATMENT PLANT WHICH IS EXPECTED TO LEAD TO IMPROVED WATER QUALITY AND ADEQUATE WATER SUPPLY FOR THE TOWN'S RESIDENTS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE INTERSTATE SUSQUEHANNA RIVER BASIN COMMISSION TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE WATERSHED ASSESSMENTS, WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENTS AND POLLUTION PREVENTION AND WATERSHED PARTNERSHIPS AND COORDINATION.; SAMPLING OF PROBABILISTIC SITES IN SPRING 2022;  SAMPLING MACROINVERTEBRATES AND WATER QUALITY AT TARGET SITES TO DOCUMENT THE NEED FOR RESTORATION ACTIVITY OR TO DOCUMENT CHANGES AFTER RESTORATION HAS BEEN COMPLETED; PROVIDING GIS SUPPORT FOR WATER QUALITY, WATERSHED, AND WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROJECTS AND STUDIES; CREATING SUPPLEMENTAL DATABASES WITH DATA COLLECTED BY OTHER AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE BASIN.

THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE BASIN.  THE COMMISSION WILL CONTINUE TO COORDINATE WATER QUALI
